title: Zhuhai Gree Group donates oxygen and food baskets to Amazonas, Brazil in January 2021 (Linked to Project ID #98604, #98605, #97746, and #97747)
description: On January 22, 2021, the ambassador of the People's Republic of China, Mr. Yang Wanming, handed over new donations and emergency aid for the Amazonian population to the Governor of Amazonas, Wilson Lima. The purpose of this donation is to help support the effort against COVID-19 in Brazil.  The donation includes a cash donation of USD 80,000 – donated by the National Red Cross Society of the People's Republic of China to the Fund for Social Promotion and Eradication of Poverty in Amazonas, an entity linked to the Civil House; 50,000 masks – sent by the Government of Guangdong Province; 25 oxygen concentrators – donated by Huawei; 900 kg of oxygen and 200 basic food baskets - donated by the Chinese company Gree; 300,000 masks – contribution from the Chinese company BYD Brasil; 10 thousand masks – by the Chinese company XCMG; ISO Container – donation equivalent to 1,700 cylinders of oxygen, from Instituto Sociocultural Brasil/China – IBRACHINA.  Zhuhai Gree Group Co.'s contribution is captured in Project ID #97190. Guangdong Province's contribution is captured in Project ID#98604. XCMG's contribution is captured in Project ID#98605. The National Red Cross Society of the People's Republic of China's contribution is captured in Project ID #97746. The private companies' contribution is captured in Project ID #97747.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title

# Description
On January 22, 2021, the ambassador of the People's Republic of China, Mr. Yang Wanming, handed over new donations and emergency aid for the Amazonian population to the Governor of Amazonas, Wilson Lima. The purpose of this donation is to help support the effort against COVID-19 in Brazil.  The donation includes a cash donation of USD 80,000 – donated by the National Red Cross Society of the People's Republic of China to the Fund for Social Promotion and Eradication of Poverty in Amazonas, an entity linked to the Civil House; 50,000 masks – sent by the Government of Guangdong Province; 25 oxygen concentrators – donated by Huawei; 900 kg of oxygen and 200 basic food baskets - donated by the Chinese company Gree; 300,000 masks – contribution from the Chinese company BYD Brasil; 10 thousand masks – by the Chinese company XCMG; ISO Container – donation equivalent to 1,700 cylinders of oxygen, from Instituto Sociocultural Brasil/China – IBRACHINA.  Zhuhai Gree Group Co.'s contribution is captured in Project ID #97190. Guangdong Province's contribution is captured in Project ID#98604. XCMG's contribution is captured in Project ID#98605. The National Red Cross Society of the People's Republic of China's contribution is captured in Project ID #97746. The private companies' contribution is captured in Project ID #97747.
justification: Project is focused on humanitarian aid and social development, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donations include oxygen, food baskets, masks, and cash for COVID-19 relief efforts in Amazonas, Brazil

title: Chinese Government donates 52,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $936,000 in February 2021
description: On February 10, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 52,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Brunei.  The Chinese Government delivered an additional 100,000 donated Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine doses and 102,400 syringes to the Government of Brunei. (Project #96150)
staff_comments: 1. According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18 (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En). As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the February 2021 donation as $936,000.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government donates 52,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $936,000 in February 2021

# Description
On February 10, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 52,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Brunei.  The Chinese Government delivered an additional 100,000 donated Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine doses and 102,400 syringes to the Government of Brunei. (Project #96150)
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact

title: Chinese Embassy in Brunei donates computers to 8 Chinese schools in Brunei in 2021
description: On October 15th, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Brunei held an online handover ceremony for donating computers to eight Chinese schools in Brunei. Ambassador Yu Hong, Political Counselor Wang Haitao, Member of Parliament Wang Changhe and other chairmen and principals of the eight Chinese schools attended the ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy in Brunei donates computers to 8 Chinese schools in Brunei in 2021

# Description
On October 15th, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Brunei held an online handover ceremony for donating computers to eight Chinese schools in Brunei. Ambassador Yu Hong, Political Counselor Wang Haitao, Member of Parliament Wang Changhe and other chairmen and principals of the eight Chinese schools attended the ceremony.
justification: Project focuses on educational support through computer donations, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of computers to schools, educational focus, no energy-related components

title: Chinese Embassy in Brunei donates 202 books to Paduka Seri Begawan Sultan Science College in Brunei
description: On June 12, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Brunei held a book donation ceremony for the Paduka Seri Begawan Sultan Science College in the library of the school. Ambassador Yu Hong, Political Counselor Wang Haitao, Dean Susi Rawadi, Vice Dean, teachers and students attended the ceremony. 202 books were donated.

title: Chinese Embassy in Brunei donates 202 books to the Yayasan Sultan Hj Hassanal Bolkiah School
description: On June 10, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Brunei held a book donation ceremony in the Brunei Yayasan Sultan Hj Hassanal Bolkiah School library. Ambassador Yu Hong, Political Counselor Wang Haitao, CEO of the school Mohammad Freety, the principal and teachers attend. The 202 donated books cover various aspects of China's economy, science and technology, literature, art and tourism.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy in Brunei donates 202 books to the Yayasan Sultan Hj Hassanal Bolkiah School

# Description
On June 10, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Brunei held a book donation ceremony in the Brunei Yayasan Sultan Hj Hassanal Bolkiah School library. Ambassador Yu Hong, Political Counselor Wang Haitao, CEO of the school Mohammad Freety, the principal and teachers attend. The 202 donated books cover various aspects of China's economy, science and technology, literature, art and tourism.
justification: Book donation to a school is a social development project with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
